result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Garrett A. Sparkman

records.addlTxt: Case called @ 9:44 AM: Defendant Garrett A. Sparkman in court, in custody. Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Garrett A. Sparkman. Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. The Court entertains wavier of the preliminary hearing. The Court accepts voluntary waiver of the preliminary hearing. Defendant BOT. Information filed. Receipt admitted - Reading waived. Defendant advised of potential punishment.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained. Collateral consequences explained. Consequences explained for failure to abide by terms of PPDA. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: Counts 1, 2, & 3 - NC. Court accepts plea and stays JOC. Count 4 - DRI. Court accepts terms and conditions of PPDA. Matter stayed for 3 years. The Defendant is ordered to successfully complete the Waushara County Treatment Court Program. The Court reminds the Defendant that bond remains in effect throughout the pendency of the PPDA.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Garrett A. Sparkman.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Rae requesting a P/S hearing.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 7, 2022 at 09:30 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD:  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Garrett A. Sparkman. Atty Rae requesting a STC.
Status conference scheduled for September 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on September 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

NOT PUT OF RECORD: Attorney Dennis Ryan in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Rae in court for Garrett A. Sparkman. Atty Rae advises that the parties are still awaiting the competency evaluation to be completed in another county and is requesting another STC.
Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 02:35 pm.
Status conference on August 8, 2022 at 02:35 pm.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.

Case called @ 1:21 PM Defendant Garrett A. Sparkman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morgan Rae appeared by video for Garrett A. Sparkman. Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and potential punishment.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel. DE is eligible for SPD services. Bond argument by DA Leusink. Bond argument by Atty Rae. Atty Rae raises the issue of competency. Court orders: $1500 cash bond. Court orders 971.14 evaluation. Atty Rae advises a 971.14 evaluation was already ordered in another matter in Winnebago Co. The Court will allow that evaluation to pertain to this case. STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State.
Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 11:25 am.
Status conference on July 7, 2022 at 11:25 am.
